body_html:
@weichiche: Had a random idea and it seems to work with placeholders. It may help in figuring this out

import tensorflow as tf
import numpy as np

x = np.array([247.], dtype=np.float32)
y = x / 255.

with tf.device('/device:CPU:0'):
  a = tf.placeholder(tf.float32)
  b = tf.placeholder(tf.float32)
  c = a / b

config = tf.ConfigProto(log_device_placement=True)
with tf.Session(config=config) as sess:
  _c = sess.run(c, feed_dict={a:x, b:255.})

print('TF:    {:12.10f}'.format(_c[0]))
print('NUMPY: {:12.10f}'.format(y[0]))

body:
@weichiche: Had a random idea and it seems to work with placeholders.  It may help in figuring this out

```
import tensorflow as tf
import numpy as np

x = np.array([247.], dtype=np.float32)
y = x / 255.

with tf.device('/device:CPU:0'):
  a = tf.placeholder(tf.float32)
  b = tf.placeholder(tf.float32)
  c = a / b

config = tf.ConfigProto(log_device_placement=True)
with tf.Session(config=config) as sess:
  _c = sess.run(c, feed_dict={a:x, b:255.})

print('TF:    {:12.10f}'.format(_c[0]))
print('NUMPY: {:12.10f}'.format(y[0]))
```
